Data Structures with Java
Software Supplement API

The API describes the packages that make up the software supplement for the book Data Structures with Java.

See:
          Description

Packages
ds.graphics The Graphics package provides tools to display geometric figures and text on a drawing surface.
ds.time This package describes objects that meaure 24-hour time and that measure the elapsed time for a process to execute.
ds.util This package provides the interfaces and collection classes that are developed in the book.

 

The API describes the packages that make up the software supplement for the book Data Structures with Java. The software is available from the author's Web site "http://www.fordtopp.com" and from Prentice Hall.

The software supplement resides in the directory ftjavads which consists of two directories programs and packages.The programs directory contains a separate subdirectory for each chapter in the book. Look in the subdirectory to find the source files and data files for programs in the chapter. When specified,you will also find files that can be used for the exercises.

The packages directory contains the software that is used throughout the book. Its organization defines a "ds" subdirectory which branches to directories corresponding to the packages graphics, time, and util. The graphics package is the tools used to give graphical demonstrations of selected algorithms and to display the different kinds of binary search tree introduced in the book. The time package includes the Time24 class that is used extensively in the book to explain new concepts. It also contains a Timing class whose objects can time the length a process run. We use this to compare the efficiency of different algorithms. The util package contains the interfaces, collection classes, and static method libraries that are introduced in the book.
